Shell.host_computer: Returns the computer associated with the Shell.
Shell.start_terminal: Launch an active terminal from the Shell.
Shell.build:
Compile the source code of the file that is in the provided path, and save the executable in the destination path.
The name of the executable is the same as that of the source file without the extension.
The provided paths must be absolutes.

Returns a string (empty on success, or with an error on failure)
Shell.connect_service:
Connect to a remote service. You can specify 'ftp' in the serviceType to request a FtpShell

Returns a Shell or FtpShell if the connection has been established correctly or null on failure.
Shell.launch:
Launches the command in the provided path.

Returns null on success, or 0 on failure.
Shell.ping: Returns true if the remote address could be reached, false otherwise. Firewalls do not block ping requests.
Shell.scp:
Copy a file from one computer to the other through the network.

Returns 1 on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure.

AptClient.show:
Shows all packages available in repository
The repository MUST be added in the /etc/apt/sources.txt file.

Returns string with all pachages on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure.
AptClient.search:
Search specifically for the package in any of the repositories listed in /etc/apt/sources.txt

Returns either a string with information about the package, or a string (containing an error) on failure.
AptClient.update:
Update the list of available packages after adding a new repository in /etc/apt/sources.txt, or if the remote repository has updated its information in /server/conf/repod.conf

Returns string containing all repository addresses with 'Updated' prefix on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure.
AptClient.add_repo:
Add the repository address in the /etc/apt/sources.txt file

Returns empty string on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure.
AptClient.del_repo:
Remove the repository address in the /etc/apt/sources.txt file.

Returns empty string on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure.
AptClient.install:
Install the program or library from a remote repository listed in /etc/apt/sources.txt.
Unless a path is specified, the program installs in /lib if it is a library or in /bin otherwise

Returns a string (containing an error) on failure or empty on success.
AptClient.check_upgrade:
Check if there is a newer version of the file in the repository.

Returns a string (containing an error) on failure or is empty when succesful.

MetaMail.delete:
Delete the mail that corresponds with mail_ID.

Returns 1 if it was removed successfully or a string with the error message.
MetaMail.fetch:
Get all mails

Returns a string type list of the received emails, with a content preview. In case of error, it returns a string.
MetaMail.read:
Read the full mail. The mail_ID argument can be obtained with fetch method.

Returns either the content as a string or an error message.
MetaMail.send:
Send a new mail to the indicated recipient.

Returns 1 if the mail has been sent correctly, otherwise returns a string with the error.

FtpShell.host_computer: Returns the computer associated with the FtpShell.
FtpShell.start_terminal: Launch an active terminal from the FtpShell.
FtpShell.put:
Copy a file from one computer to the other through the network.

Returns 1 on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure.

Crypto.aircrack: Returns a string with the password generated from the file created by aireplay.
Crypto.airmon: Enables or disables the monitor mode of a network device. The option parameter can only be 'start' or 'stop'.
Crypto.aireplay:
Used to inject frames on wireless interfaces.



Once the command with Control+C is stopped, it will save the captured information in a text file called file.cap in the path where the terminal is currently located.

Alternatively, a maximum of captured acks can be specified for the command to stop automatically, saving the file.cap file as described above.

In the event that there is an error, a string will be returned with the message indicating the problem.
Crypto.decipher: Start the process of decrypting the password.
Crypto.smtp_user_list:
SMTP services are mail services. When using this method with the IP of a mail server, due to a vulnerability in the service, it returns a list of the existing users on the computer where the SMTP service is working. 
If these users also have an email account registered on the SMTP server, it will be indicated in the list.

Returns a list object of all users on the machine, along with their email address or returns a string containing an error

MetaLib.lib_name: Returns the name of the library.
MetaLib.version: Returns the version of the library.
MetaLib.overflow:
Exploits the indicated vulnerability through the buffer overflow method.
The object returned can be of various types or even not return anything, so it is advisable to use the typeof method with the object returned.
Depending on the result, it may be necessary to pass extra arguments so that the exploit runs correctly, for example in the case of a password change.

Metaxploit.load: Load the library in memory and return it as a metalib type if the process was successful.
Metaxploit.net_use:
It connects to the specified address and establishes a null session to gain access to a library remotely.
This type of attack is only available for services that work remotely.
If no port is specified, it will connect directly to the router.
If the process has been executed correctly, an object of type net_session will be returned.
Metaxploit.rshell_client:
Launches a process on the victim's machine, which silently tries to continuously connect in the background to the specified address and port.
For the reverse shell to run successfully, the rshell service must be installed and the portforward configured correctly on the machine where the server is waiting for the victim's connection.
Metaxploit.rshell_server:
This method returns a list of shell objects that have been reverse shell connected to this machine.
In order to manage the connections received, the rshell service must be installed on the machine that receives the victims' connections.
Metaxploit.scan_address: It analyzes a specific memory address and shows the vulnerable parts that can be exploited.
Metaxploit.scan: Analyze the memory areas occupied by the library in search of vulnerabilities. Returns a list with the affected memory zones.
Metaxploit.sniffer:
The terminal listens to the network packets of any connection that passes through this device. 
When any connection information is captured, it prints a string with the obtained data. 
It can save the source code of the encode script if saveEncSource is true.
Null is returned if the listen could not be started.

Port.port_number: Returns an number with the configured port number.
Port.is_closed: Returns true if this port is closed, false otherwise.
Port.get_lan_ip: Returns a string with the local IP address of the computer pointed to by this port.

Router.bssid_name: Returns a string with the BSSID value of the router.
Router.device_ports: Takes a LAN IP address and returns a list with open ports accessible in the network.
Router.devices_lan_ip:
Returns a list with any computer whose gateway is the current device with the ips of the routers and switches that it can reach with a ping. 
Some of the returned addresses could be behind a firewall
Router.essid_name: Returns a string with the ESSID value of the router.
Router.firewall_rules: Returns a string list with the firewall rules present in the router or switch.
Router.kernel_version: Returns a string with the version of the kernel_router.so library
Router.local_ip: Returns a string with the router's local ip address.
Router.ping_port: Returns the port object that is behind the port number provided if exists, null otherwise.
Router.port_info: Returns a string with the information of the port that has been provided. The port provided must not belong to another network than this router.
Router.public_ip: Returns a string with the router's public ip address.
Router.used_ports: Returns an array of ports that are being used in this router.

NetSession.dump_lib:
Returns the metalib associated with the remote service.



For example, connecting to a computer with the ssh service will return a metalib libssh object.

In the case of connecting to a router, it returns a metalib kernel_router object.

File.chmod:
Modifies the file's permissions



Takes a permissions string (e.g. u+wr) and optional recursive flag (int 0 or 1)

If the file is a folder and the recursive flag is 1, the permissions change will apply recursively, to all the files and folders inside the folder.

Returns a string (empty on success, or with an error on failure)
File.copy:
Copy the file to the specified path.

On success, returns 1 and the terminal outputs the copied file dialogue. On failure, returns either an error (string) such as permission denied or null (if File object not valid).
File.move:
Move the file to the specified path.

On success, returns 1. On failure, returns either an error (string) such as permission denied or null (if File object not valid).
File.rename:
Rename the file with the name provided.

Returns a string (empty on success, or with an error on failure)
File.path: Returns a string with the absolute path of the file.
File.parent: Returns the folder that contains this file or null if the initial object is /.
File.name: Returns a string with the name of the file.
File.get_content: Returns a string with the contents of the text file.
File.set_content:
Save the text in the file. The content will be overwritten if there is already text saved in the file.

Returns 1 on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure
File.is_folder: Returns true if the file is folder, false otherwise.
File.is_binary: Returns true if the file is binary, false otherwise.
File.has_permission:
Returns true if the user who launches the script has the necessary permissions.
The type_perm parameter is used for reading ('r'), writing ('w') and execution ('x')
File.delete:
Delete the file

Returns a string (empty on success, or with an error on failure)
File.get_folders: Returns an array of the folders contained in this object. This function is only available if this object is a folder, so it is advisable to first use the is_folder function before calling this method.
File.get_files: Returns an array of files (excluded folders) contained in this object. This function is only available if this object is a folder, so it is advisable to first use the is_folder function before calling this method.
File.permissions: Returns a string with the current file permissions.
File.owner: Returns a string with the name of the file owner.
File.set_owner:
Apply a owner to this file. By default, the owner does not apply recursively. To apply the owner recursively, the optional parameter must be 1.

Returns a string (empty on success, or with an error on failure)
File.group: Returns a string with the name of the group to which this file belongs.
File.set_group:
Apply a group to this file. By default, the group does not apply recursively. To apply the group recursively, the optional parameter must be 1.

Returns a string (empty on success, or with an error on failure)
File.size: Returns a string with the size of the file in bytes.

Computer.local_ip: Returns a string with the computer's local ip address.
Computer.public_ip: Returns a string with the computer's public ip address.
Computer.get_ports: Returns an array of active ports on the computer.
Computer.File: Returns the file located in the given path, relative or absolute. The file returned can be a folder. If the file does not exist, it is returned null.
Computer.create_folder: Create a folder in the specified path.
Computer.is_network_active: Returns true if the computer has internet access, false otherwise.
Computer.touch:
Create an empty text file.

Returns 1 on success, or a string (containing an error) on failure
Computer.show_procs: Returns a string with the list of active processes on the machine.
Computer.network_devices: Returns a string with the list of network devices available on the computer.
Computer.change_password:
Change the password of an existing user on the machine, for a new one.
It is necessary to be root to be able to execute the method.

Returns 1 on success, or error string on failure
Computer.create_user:
Create a user on the machine, with the specified name and password. It is necessary to be root to be able to execute the method.

Returns 1 on success, or error string on failure
Computer.delete_user:
Delete the indicated user from the computer, also deleting its home folder optionally. 
By default, if the optional parameter is not passed, the home folder will not be deleted.
It is necessary to be root to be able to execute the method.

Returns 1 on success, or error string on failure
Computer.create_group:
Create a new group associated with an existing user on the machine. It is necessary to be root to be able to execute the method.

Returns 1 on success, or error string on failure
Computer.delete_group:
Delete the indicated user group. It is necessary to be root in order to execute this method.

Returns 1 on success, or error string on failure
Computer.groups: Returns a string with the list of groups created in the indicated user.
Computer.close_program:
Close the program associated with the PID. To show the list of the running programs along with their PIDs use the ps command.

Returns 1 on success, 0 if the process cannot be found, or an error string on failure to terminate the process
Computer.wifi_networks: Returns a list of the Wi-Fi networks that are available.
Computer.connect_wifi:
Connect to the indicated Wifi network. Returns true if the connection was successful.

Returns 1 on successful connection, null if the network cannot be found, or an error string on connection failure
Computer.connect_ethernet:
Notice: Ethernet is currently disabled in multiplayer on both public and nightly builds!

Set up a new IP address on the machine through the ethernet connection.
Returns a string with the error message if the connection failed. In case of success, an empty string is returned.
Computer.network_gateway: Returns a string with the gateway configured on the computer.
Computer.active_net_card: Returns a string with the keyword WIFI if the current device is connected to a router by WiFi, if it is connected by cable a string with the keyword ETHERNET is returned.

General.mail_login:
Access the email account

Returns a MetaMail type object if the login has been correct. In case of error, it returns a string
General.typeof: Returns a string with the type of the object passed as a parameter.
General.get_router:
Returns the router whose public IP matches, otherwise returns null.
If the ip_address parameter is not specified, returns the router to which the computer executing this command is connected.
General.get_switch: Returns the switch on the local network whose IP matches, otherwise it returns null.
General.nslookup: Returns the IP address that is behind the web address that has been provided.
General.print: Print on the Terminal the message.
General.clear_screen: Clears all text from the terminal.
General.active_user: Returns a string with the name of the user who is executing the script.
General.home_dir: Returns a string with home folder path of the user who is executing the script.
General.get_shell:
Returns the shell that is executing the script if it is called without parameters. 
Passing a username and password, it returns a shell with those credentials if are correct.
General.user_input: It puts the program on hold to receive the user input, which will be processed as a string. If the password mode is activated, the input text will be hidden with asterisks. If the anyKey argument is true, the entered character will be captured without pressing enter.
General.include_lib: Includes an external library to be used in scripting. If the library has been included correctly, it will return an object of corresponding type with the library, null otherwise
General.import_code:
Includes external code into the current code. Can be used to split code in multiple files.
Note: The code will be added to the current code upon compiling.
General.exit: Stops the execution of the script at the time this method is executed. Optionally you can pass a string as a message that will be printed in the terminal when the program ends.
General.user_mail_address:
Returns a string with the user's email address that is executing this script.
This is only defined on a player's home computer.
General.user_bank_number:
Returns a string with the bank account number of the user who is executing this script.
This is only defined on a player's home computer.
General.whois: Shows the administrator information behind the IP provided.
General.wait: Pauses the script for the indicated time. If duration is not specified, the default value is 1 second.
General.command_info: Returns the information of common commands of the Operating System, such as mkdir, whois, etc.
General.program_path: Returns a string with the path of the program that is running at this time.
General.current_path: It returns a string with the path in which the terminal is at the moment of launching the script.
General.format_columns: Format the text provided so that it is ordered by columns.
General.is_lan_ip: Returns true if the provided address is local, false otherwise. If the provided IP is not valid, it also returns false.
General.is_valid_ip: Returns true if the provided address is valid, false otherwise.
General.bitwise:
Bitwise operators are used for manipulating data at the bit level.
Bitwise operates on one or more bit patterns or binary numerals at the level of their individual bits. 
They are used in numerical computations to make the calculation process faster.
The operator argument accepts the following operators:
&, |, ^, <<, >>, >>>
General.hash: Returns a integer that is "relatively unique" to the given value. In the case of strings, the hash is case-sensitive. In the case of a list r map, the hash combines the hash values of all elements.
General.launch_path: Returns the path of the program that launched this program.
General.abs: Returns the absolute value of the provided input.
General.acos: Returns the arccosine of the provided input in radians.
General.asin: Returns the arcsine of the provided input in radians.
General.atan: Returns the arctangent of the provided input in radians.
General.tan: Returns the tangent of the provided input.
General.cos: Returns the cosine of the provided input.
General.sin: Returns the sine of the provided input.
General.char: Returns the unicode character at the provided input's code point.
General.floor: Returns the provided input floored to it's base integer.
General.range: Returns a list object containing values from the start to the end, incrementing by increment.
General.round: Returns the provided input rounded to the decimal place provided.
General.rnd: Returns a random float between 0 and 1. If seed is provide, it seeds the random number with the given value.
General.sign: Returns the sign of the provided input.
General.sqrt: Returns the square root of the provided input.
General.str: Converts the provided input into a string.
General.ceil: Returns the provided input raised to the next or equal integer.
General.pi: Returns 3.14159265358979 (this will probably never be useful!)
General.for: A for loop can loop over any list, including ones easily created with the range function.
General.while: Use a while block to loop as long as a condition is true.
General.break: The break statement jumps out of a while or for loop
General.continue: The continue statement jumps to the top of the loop, skipping the rest of the current iteration.
General.if:
Use if blocks to do different things depending on some condition.
You can include an else or an else if to create conditions for all your needs.
General.else:
Use else blocks to do things if the previous if condition was false.
An else block can be chained with an if creating a conditional else block.
General.slice: Returns the provided string or list from index start to index end.
General.function: Create a user defined function block where you can run your own snippets of code.
General.then: Ends the conditioning of an if statement.

String.remove: Returns the string without the first occurrence of the provided substring.
String.hasIndex: Returns 1 if the index exists. Returns 0 otherise.
String.indexOf: Returns the first index of the provided input with the string. Optionally searches after begin. Returns Null if not found.
String.lastIndexOf: Returns the last index of the provided input with the string. Optionally searches after begin. Returns Null if not found.
String.split: Returns a list object of substrings.
String.replace: Returns the string with any instances of new replaced with old.
String.trim: Returns the string stripped of any spacing at the beginning or end.
String.indexes: Returns a list object containing indexes of all characters in the string.
String.code: Returns the unicode code point of the first character in the string.
String.len: Returns the length of the provided object.
String.val: Converts the string to a float.
String.values: Returns a list object containing values of all characters in the string.
String.to_int: Converts the string to a integer.

List.hasIndex: Returns 1 if the index exists. Returns 0 otherise.
List.indexOf: Returns the index of the provided value. Optionally searches after begin. Returns Null if not found.
List.push: Pushes the provided input onto the end of the list. Returns the updated list, and updates the list in it's place.
List.pop: Returns the key of the first element in the list, and removes that element from the list.
List.pull: Returns the first element of the list, and removes that element from the list.
List.shuffle: Randomly remaps values in a list, leaving the keys in their original order.
List.join: Concatenates all items within the list and returns them in a single string.
List.reverse: Reverses the list, rearranging the element in reverse order.
List.remove: Returns the list without the first occurrence of the provided input.
List.indexes: Returns a list object containing the list's indexes
List.len: Returns the length of the provided object.
List.values: Returns a list object containing the list's values
List.sum: Returns the total of all numeric values in a list.

Map.hasIndex: Returns 1 if the index exists. Returns 0 otherise.
Map.indexOf: Returns the first index of the provided input with the string. Optionally searches after begin. Returns Null if not found.
Map.push: Pushes the provided input onto the end of the map. Returns the updated map, and updates the map in it's place.
Map.pop: Returns the key of the first element in the map, and removes that element from the map.
Map.shuffle: Randomly remaps values in a map, leaving the keys in their original order.
Map.remove: Returns the map without the first occurrence of the provided input.
Map.indexes: Returns a list object containing the map's indexes.
Map.len: Returns the length of the provided object.
Map.values: Returns a list object containing the map's values.
Map.sum: Returns the total of all numeric values in a map.
